options.caption: This maple tree has a central stem, called a trunk, that connects the roots to the branches of the tree.
options.imageAlt: This photograph shows a maple tree that has a thick trunk, or stem, with branches and leaves.

options.caption: The root system of the saguaro cactus is shallow, but it reaches out as far as the plant is tall.
options.imageAlt: In this photograph, several saguaro cacti grow in the desert. The cacti have needles instead of leaves.

options.caption: The water lilyâ€™s broad, flat leaves float on the water to maximize the amount of sunlight they can capture.
options.imageAlt: In this photograph, the large, flat leaves of the water lily are shown floating on water. The image also shows the thin stems of the water lilies growing down into the water.
